executableContent.instructions:
Let's apply our knowledge of creating a flexbox container to building the following navigation menu for an Italian bakery website.

Most of the HTML we need has already been written, so let's focus on first working on the style. The heading does not look good left aligned so let's center it.

1. In styles.css, create a CSS rule for the `<h1>` element and center it using `text-align`.

executableContent.instructions:
Since there are many `<div>` elements in our HTML document, it will be time consuming and confusing to apply styles to particular `<div>` elements in CSS.  

Hence, we will add a class to the parent `<div>` that we can then target in our CSS rules. 

1. Add a class `container` to the parent `<div>` of our navigation that we will later transform into a flexbox container.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's add some additional declarations to our `.container` rule. 

1. Set the `width` to `100%`.
2. Set the `background-color` to `#DE9C51`.
3. Set the `color` to `#FFFFFF`.

Just like the container `<div>`, we will add a class to each of the flex item elements nested inside the container. This will allow us to create a single rule that can target and style all the nav elements at once. 

1. Add the `item` class to each of the divs nested inside our container `<div>`.
